info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 5:43PM CDT until July 27 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following counties, DuPage, Kane and McHenry.
* WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated nearly stationary thunderstorms along a line from near Huntley to West Chicago. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has fallen based on radar and automated gauges. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elgin, Wheaton, Crystal Lake, Carol Stream, Hanover Park, Carpentersville, St. Charles, Algonquin, Lake in the Hills, Glen Ellyn, West Chicago, Batavia, Huntley, Geneva, Campton Hills, South Elgin, North Aurora and Warrenville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: DuPage, IL; Kane, IL; McHenry, IL
